text.section:
After passing a stop order, the Commissioner promptly shall send to the applicant or registrant a notice that:
states that the stop order has been passed;
states the reasons for the stop order; and
informs the applicant or registrant of the right to a hearing under this section.

section.section: The applicant or registrant may submit to the Commissioner a written request for a hearing on the stop order.
The Commissioner shall schedule a hearing within 15 business days after the Commissioner receives the request unless the applicant or registrant consents to a later date.
The Commissioner may schedule a hearing even if the applicant or registrant does not request a hearing.
If a hearing is not requested and is not scheduled by the Commissioner and therefore is not held, the stop order remains in effect until the Commissioner modifies or vacates it.
If a hearing is held, after the hearing, the Commissioner may modify or vacate the stop order or extend it until the Commissioner makes a final determination.

The Commissioner may modify or vacate a stop order if the Commissioner finds that:
conditions have changed; or
it is otherwise in the public interest to vacate or modify the stop order.
